dateline.placeName: OFFICE OF ALL THE YEAR ROUND,

body.p: Immediately on receipt of your letter, I bestirred myself to get the required documents.Toward settling Alfred Dickens’s affairs; Alfred had died, 27 July, in Manchester. It is not clear why Mayhew was involved. Both are enclosed herein.Presumably the death certificate and some evidence of birth or baptism (not until the Act of 1836 was full registration of births, deaths and marriages required by law). Alfred was born 11 Mar 22 and baptized 3 Apr 22. You will observe in the extract from the Chatham Register, that poor Alfred having been born before the General Registration days, was not elaborately ticketed and labelled as the [ ] Incomplete word deleted; possibly “young” or “youth” intended. infants of this generation.
